citeinfo.title: United States Geological Survey (USGS) 1:250,000 Topographic Quadrangle Series Index, 2022

descript.abstract: U.S. USGS 1:250,000 Quadrangle Series Topographic Index represents the geographic extent of USGS 1:250,000 scale topographic maps (1- by 2-degree quadrangles) for the coterminous U.S. forty-eight states and District of Columbia.
descript.purpose: U.S. USGS 1:250,000 Quadrangle Series Topographic Index provides quadrangle name, identification number, publication data, and map coverage by state for each quadrangle. This small-scale index grid can be a handy visual reference for regional displays.

cntinfo.cntinst:

Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States- Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired. Occasionally, USGS actual quadrangles depart from a completely rectangular format mainly because of map sheet production considerations in coastal areas and offshore islands that result in rotation, offset, over edge, and inset sheet layouts. These are not represented precisely by the data set, but the correct attribute information is included.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was mathematically generated using the ARC/INFO GRID™ extension. In this manner, the locations of the quadrangles were computed. The positional accuracy for these quadrangles is limited only by the resolution of the data set which is 51 meters.

citeinfo.title: ArcUSA™ 1:2M
citeinfo.othercit: USGS Topographic Quadrangles dates of publication 1958 through 1986.

procstep.procdesc: This data set was generated from several sources: the geospatial part of this data set was mathematically generated using the ARC/INFO GRID extension. The USGS Topographic Names Database and the Published Map Sheet Data File (T-70) were the two primary digital sources for the attributes. Where these databases were incomplete, various published USGS map indexes were consulted to update the attributes.

The following steps were performed by Esri: Extracted data set from ArcUSA 1:2M. Removed unneeded attributes. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr). Created projection file (.prj). Ran ArcView GIS Avenue™ request ExportClean, and created spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.
The following steps were performed by Esri: Made QUAD_NAME attribute title case.
Converted the dataset into a file geodatabase.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent a systematic grid of 1- by 2-degree quadrangles based on a latitude-longitude graticule for the coterminous U.S. forty-eight states and District of Columbia. Each 1- by 2-degree quadrangle is 128 times the area of a USGS 1:24,000 topographic quadrangle and 4 times the area of a USGS 1:100,000 topographic quadrangle.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The quadrangle identification number. The first two digits represent the latitude in degrees north, the next three digits represent the longitude in degrees west, and a hyphen, and the last two characters reveal the grid cell code within each one-degree rectangle. To understand the grid cell code within the one-degree rectangle, imagine a rectangle the shape of a door. Divide the "door" into eight rows (A-H) and columns (1-8), the lower right corner grid cell code is "A1" and the upper left corner grid cell code is "H8". Each grid cell represents a USGS 1:24,000 topographic quadrangle, hence sixty-four per one-degree rectangle. Each USGS 1:100,000 topographic quadrangle is one-half by one degree with only two fitting within the one-degree rectangle-the upper half and the lower half of the "door". The lower quadrangle's grid cell code is "A1" and the upper quadrangle's grid cell code is "E1" (these are the only grid cell codes for USGS 1:100,000 topographic quadrangles). Each USGS 1:250,000 topographic quadrangle is one by two degrees, which, is two "doors" side by side. The quadrangle's grid cell code is "A1" (this is the only grid cell code for USGS 1:250,000 topographic quadrangles).
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Geological Survey as interpreted and described by Esri

codesetd.codesetn: USGS Topographic Names Database, Published Map Sheet Data File (T-70)

attr.attrdef: The type of map for the quadrangle. If several types of maps exist for the same quadrangle, the lowest code value is listed.
The name of the state in which the quadrangle is located. The state names are always stored beginning with ST_NAME1, but they are not listed in any particular order.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The name of the second state in which the quadrangle is located. The state names are always stored beginning with ST_NAME1, but they are not listed in any particular order. If a quadrangle covers fewer than four states, this attribute may be blank.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The name of the third state in which the quadrangle is located. The state names are always stored beginning with ST_NAME1, but they are not listed in any particular order. If a quadrangle covers fewer than four states, this attribute may be blank.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The name of the fourth state in which the quadrangle is located. The state names are always stored beginning with ST_NAME1, but they are not listed in any particular order. If a quadrangle covers fewer than four states, this attribute may be blank.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The most recent date of revision for the quadrangle, expressed as the last two digits of the year in the twentieth century.
The most recent date of publication for the quadrangle, expressed as the last two digits of the year in the twentieth century.
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
